intro: Troximon coronopifolium, commonly known as the crown-of-thorns plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Native to parts of Africa, it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant's leaves are typically narrow and pointed, often arranged in a rosette pattern. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and hardiness.
